info.title: 카카오톡 메시징 및 일정 관리
info.description: 카카오톡으로 다양한 유형의 메시지를 보내고, 캘린더를 조회하고 일정을 추가할 수 있어요. 친구 목록도 조회할 수 있어요. 텍스트 메시지는 물론 이미지, 링크, 위치 정보 등을 포함한 다양한 형태의 메시지를 전송할 수 있어요. 개인 캘린더와 채널 캘린더를 관리하여 효율적인 일정 관리가 가능해요. 친구나 그룹채팅방에 일정을 공유하고, 알림을 설정할 수 있어 중요한 약속을 잊지 않을 수 있어요.

post.summary: Send a message to a KakaoTalk(카카오톡) friend
post.description:
Sends a text type KakaoTalk(카카오톡) message to a friend

KakaoTalk(카카오톡) is a mobile messenger application in South Korea, which also provides various additional services.

post.summary: Send a message to myself on KakaoTalk(카카오톡)
post.description:
Sends a commerce type message to myself on KakaoTalk(카카오톡)

When sending a KakaoTalk(카카오톡) message, there are buttons. If you want to add a link to the button, you should use a URL starting with `https://studio-pro.wrtn.ai/` or a redirect link. If the link starts with `https://studio-pro.wrtn.ai/`, the page will be viewed, otherwise, it will redirect to the new link. This is because only links registered in our domain are allowed according to the KakaoTalk(카카오톡) API specifications.

KakaoTalk(카카오톡) is a mobile messenger application in South Korea, which also provides various additional services.

requestBody.description: Conditions for retrieving the friend list

post.summary: Retrieve the list of friends on KakaoTalk(카카오톡)
post.description:
Retrieves the list of friends on KakaoTalk(카카오톡)

KakaoTalk(카카오톡) is a mobile messenger application in South Korea, which also provides various additional services.

Retrieves KakaoTalk(카카오톡) calendar events.

The user needs to provide the calendar ID as an input parameter.
If no calendar is provided, it defaults to retrieving the user's own calendar.
Therefore, this feature can be used even if no calendar ID is specified.

The conditions for retrieving events include specifying the period for which events are to be fetched.
This connector is designed to view data for either a week or a month.

KakaoTalk(카카오톡) is a mobile messaging application in South Korea, and it also provides additional services.

Retrieves all KakaoTalk(카카오톡) calendar lists

There are two types of calendars: your primary calendars and calendars you are subscribed to.
All Kakao users have their own personal calendars, so there will be at least one calendar.
The primary calendar has an ID of `primary`, which is the user's own calendar.

KakaoTalk(카카오톡) is a mobile messenger application from South Korea that also provides additional services.

IKakaoTalk.Social.description: Up to 3 out of 5 attributes will be displayed. Priority is Like > Comment > Shared > View > Subscriber.

x-wrtn-prerequisite.jmesPath: calendars[].{value:id, label: name || ''} || subscribe_calendars[].{value:id, label: name || ''}

calendar_id.title: Calendar ID to create the event in

event.title: Information of the event to be created

reminders.title: Reminder settings
reminders.description: In minutes, can be set in 5-minute intervals, up to 2 reminders. For all-day events, can start from -1440, for non-all-day events, starts from 0.

lunar.title: Whether to set the date based on the lunar calendar

offset.title: Starting point of the friends list

order.title: Sort order of the friends list

friend_order.title: Sort criteria of the friends list

after_url.title: Next page URL of the friends list

before_url.title: Previous page URL of the friends list

id.title: Member number
id.description:
User ID

A member number assigned to a friend in KakaoTalk, equivalent to the ID value.
Note that the `uuid` property is used when sending messages.

uuid.title: Friend code
uuid.description:
Friend code used when sending KakaoTalk messages. Used for actions such as sending KakaoTalk messages later.
Although the property name is `uuid`, it is not in the usual uuid format, so use it with caution.

favorite.title: Whether the friend is a favorite

x-wrtn-prerequisite.jmesPath: calendars[].{value:id, label: name || ''} || subscribe_calendars[].{value:id, label: name || ''}

calender_id.title: Calendar ID to Retrieve Events
calender_id.description: Defaults to retrieving all calendars if not specified.

oneOf.title: The week containing the query date starting on Sunday
The month containing the query date starting on the 1st

preset.title: Time Period for Retrieving Events
preset.description: Required if `from` and `to` are not included, and ignored if `next_page_token` is included.

time_zone.title:
Time Zone for Deadline Dates

In TZID format.

limit.title: Maximum Number of Events to Receive in Response

from.title: Start Time of the Period to Retrieve Events
from.description: Required if `from` and `to` are not included and ignored if `next_page_token` is included.

to.title: End Time of the Period to Retrieve Events
to.description: Required if `from` and `to` are not included and ignored if `next_page_token` is included. Must be within 31 days from `to`.

x-wrtn-prerequisite.jmesPath: calendars[].{value:id, label: name || ''} || subscribe_calendars[].{value:id, label: name || ''}

calender_id.title: Calendar ID to Retrieve Events
calender_id.description: Defaults to retrieving all calendars if not specified.

oneOf.title: The week containing the query date starting on Sunday
The month containing the query date starting on the 1st

preset.title: Time Period for Retrieving Events
preset.description: Required if `from` and `to` are not included, and ignored if `next_page_token` is included.

time_zone.title:
Time Zone for Deadline Dates

In TZID format.

limit.title: Maximum Number of Events to Receive in Response

next_page_token.title: Token for Pagination
next_page_token.description: Query condition token including `from`, `to`, and `limit` values, available in the `after_url` received in the response.

has_next.title: Whether there is a next page

after_url.title:
URL of the next page

A URL containing parameters and values to retrieve the next page, used as is when requesting the next page.

Provided when `has_next` is true.

x-wrtn-prerequisite.jmesPath: calendars[].{value:id, label: name || ''} || subscribe_calendars[].{value:id, label: name || ''}

calendar_id.title: Calendar ID
calendar_id.description: Fixed to primary for the default calendar

is_host.title: Whether the user is the host of the event

color.title: Event color
color.description: Not included if not specified during event creation or editing.

calendars.title: Basic Calendar
calendars.description:
Personal calendars.
Although these are personal, they are not limited to just your own events; you can view events from friends' schedules if invited or shared.

subscribe_calendars.title: List of Subscribed Calendars
subscribe_calendars.description:
Subscription calendars.
These are managed in chat rooms where multiple members have created a group. You can view the calendars of the chat rooms you belong to.

IKakaoTalk.IGetCalendarOutput.title: Talk Calendar
IKakaoTalk.IGetCalendarOutput.description:
There are two types of calendars in KakaoTalk:
1. Basic Calendar: This is a personal calendar. While it is personal, it is not limited to viewing only your own events; you can view events shared by friends or events you were invited to.
2. Subscription Calendar: This is a shared calendar managed by a group of members in a chat room. You can view the calendars of the chat rooms you are part of.

id.title:
Calendar ID.

For calendars that users typically have by default, it is referred to as `primary`.

reminder.title: Default reminder time for non-all-day events

reminder_all_day.title: Default reminder time for all-day events

description.title: Description of the subscribed calendar set by the channel

profile_image_url.title: Profile image URL of the subscribed calendar

thumbnail_url.title: Thumbnail URL of the subscribed calendar's speech bubble

Calendar ID.

For calendars that users typically have by default, it is referred to as `primary`.
